md:
giải nghĩa từ "trench" sang tiếng việt; đưa ra nghĩa tiếng việt theo từ loại và đưa ra câu ví dụ, các từ liên quan.
Trench (noun) - Hào, rãnh
* A long, narrow depression in the ground, especially one used for military defense or as a boundary.
* A long, narrow channel or depression in the ocean floor.

Example sentences:

* The soldiers dug a trench around the perimeter of the base to protect themselves from enemy fire.
* The submarine explored the trench in the ocean floor, discovering new species of fish.

Related words:

* Trench coat (noun) - Áo khoác hào: a long, waterproof coat worn in rainy or windy weather.
* Trench warfare (noun) - Chiến tranh hào: a type of warfare in which soldiers fight from trenches, often for a long period of time.
* Trenchant (adjective) - Sắc bén: sharply analytical or incisive; able to cut through confusion or uncertainty.

Note: The word "trench" can also be used as a verb, meaning to dig or make a trench. For example: "The soldiers trenched the ground to lay pipes for the new water system."
